title: Dear Richard Madeley: 'How can we stop our daughter relapsing into unhealthy habits?'
text:
Dear Richard

My daughter’s teenage years, since the age of 13, have been punctuated with issues surrounding self harm, restricted food intake and constantly saying she feels low. She has been intermittently receiving therapy.

The good news is that, at 16, she is socialising, looking forward to things and doing well at college: she seems to have sailed through her GCSEs. She has a Saturday job and enjoys playing netball with a bunch of friends.

But the negativity remains, and we believe it goes beyond normal teenage angst. It feels as if she is scared of letting go of her therapy and in order to keep it going she has to show she’s still in need. This doesn’t seem healthy – should we be encouraging...
